nodes.documentation:
@notice Determine the payments to the bands and players by calculating and then storing
 the amount due them in the claims map.  For bands that we don't find an
 address for in the band addresses array, put the amount in escrow 
 for them, using the owner ID associated with a given ID as the escrow 
 key.
     * @param _clientReferenceTimestamp - The timestamp the client passed to the
 finalizeGame() method, to be stored with the payment details structure.
@param _gameId - The game ID of the game this payment is associated with.
     * NOTE: The game must currently be in the PLAYING state.
NOTE: This method sets the game to the GAME_OVER state.
NOTE: This method does NOT make the actual payments.  It just calculates them.
NOTE: The content required for calculating payments comes from the earlier
 calls to addGameRoundResult(), made after each round of play to record 
 the details of the round.
nodes.name: finalizeGame

nodes.documentation:
@notice Web3 Code that must have a dependable way to get the ID for a
 game they recently requested to be made can poll this method every
 few seconds to see if the game was created.  This is a backup plan to
 that of listening for the CreatedNewGame event.
     * @param _requestNonce - The request nonce that was given to us 
 when makeGame() was called.
@return - Returns the game ID of the game that was created 
 during the makeGame() call.  Returns 0 if we don't have a record of 
 any new game yet for the given once, usually indicating the new game
 has not been written to the distributed ledger yet.

attributes.documentation:
@notice Determine the payments to the bands and players by calculating and then storing
 the amount due them in the claims map.  For bands that we don't find an
 address for in the band addresses array, put the amount in escrow 
 for them, using the owner ID associated with a given ID as the escrow 
 key.
     * @param _clientReferenceTimestamp - The timestamp the client passed to the
 finalizeGame() method, to be stored with the payment details structure.
@param _gameId - The game ID of the game this payment is associated with.
     * NOTE: The game must currently be in the PLAYING state.
NOTE: This method sets the game to the GAME_OVER state.
NOTE: This method does NOT make the actual payments.  It just calculates them.
NOTE: The content required for calculating payments comes from the earlier
 calls to addGameRoundResult(), made after each round of play to record 
 the details of the round.

attributes.documentation:
@notice Web3 Code that must have a dependable way to get the ID for a
 game they recently requested to be made can poll this method every
 few seconds to see if the game was created.  This is a backup plan to
 that of listening for the CreatedNewGame event.
     * @param _requestNonce - The request nonce that was given to us 
 when makeGame() was called.
@return - Returns the game ID of the game that was created 
 during the makeGame() call.  Returns 0 if we don't have a record of 
 any new game yet for the given once, usually indicating the new game
 has not been written to the distributed ledger yet.
attributes.name: getGameId

 created is 1, not 0.

attributes.documentation:
@notice Given a game ID and a round number, if a game round
 result exists for that round number, than just return the
 round number given to us.  If not, return 0, which indicates
 a game round result for that round number was never submitted
 or the Ethereum transaction that did has not been mined/confirmed
 yet.
     * @param _gameId - the ID of the game for this query.
@param _roundNum - the desired round number.
     * @return - Returns TRUE if a game round result for the given round
 number has been posted, other FALSE is returned.

attributes.documentation:
@notice Given a game ID, return TRUE if the game is ready to be 
 finalized.  Otherwise return FALSE.
     * NOTE: The game must currently be in the PLAYING state.
     * @param _gameId - the ID of the game for this query.
     * @return - Returns TRUE if the number of game round results
 posted is equal to the number of players in the game.  If TRUE, this
 indicates that all game round results have been posted and that the
 the game is ready for payment processing.  Otherwise FALSE
 is returned.

addGameRoundResult(uint256,uint256,bytes.notice: Add the results of a round of play to the game. NOTE: Any attempt to add more game round results to the game than there are rounds will be rejected.

addPlayer(uint256,address,bytes32).notice: Add a new player to the game.  Callable only by the House.

claimEscrow(bytes32,address).notice: Schedule an escrow payment on behalf of a player/band by the game server (Administrator/owner).

claimPayment(uint256,bytes32,address).notice: Make a payment on behalf of a player/band by the game server (Administrator/owner).

finalizeGame(uint256,uint256).notice: Determine the payments to the bands and players by calculating and then storing the amount due them in the claims map.  For bands that we don't find an address for in the band addresses array, put the amount in escrow  for them, using the owner ID associated with a given ID as the escrow  key.

getGameId(bytes32).notice: Web3 Code that must have a dependable way to get the ID for a game they recently requested to be made can poll this method every few seconds to see if the game was created.  This is a backup plan to that of listening for the CreatedNewGame event.

getGamePaymentsSummary(uint256).notice: - This function retrieves the payment summary for a given game ID.  The game must be in the GAME_OVER state.

getGameState(uint256).notice: Given a game ID, return the current state for that game.

getIsGameReadyToBeFinalized(uint256).notice: Given a game ID, return TRUE if the game is ready to be  finalized.  Otherwise return FALSE.     * NOTE: The game must currently be in the PLAYING state.

getIsGameRoundResultPosted(uint256,uint2.notice: Given a game ID and a round number, if a game round result exists for that round number, than just return the round number given to us.  If not, return 0, which indicates a game round result for that round number was never submitted or the Ethereum transaction that did has not been mined/confirmed yet.

getIsHouseAddrSet(uint256).notice: Given a game ID, check to see if the house address has been set for that game.

getIsPlayerInGame(uint256,address).notice: Given a game ID and a player address, return TRUE if we have a record of the player having entered the game

getLastTestEcRecoverResults().notice: This method returns the input and output data involved with the last testEcRecovery() call.

getNextPendingPaymentDetails(uint256).notice: This function gets the oldest pending payment details from the pending payment linked list.

getNumGameRoundResults(uint256).notice: Given a game ID, return the number of game round results added to the game so far.

getNumGamesCreated().notice: This function returns the number of games created since the the contracts inception.

getNumPlayers(uint256).notice: Given a game ID, return the number of players added to the game so far.

getPendingPaymentCount().notice: This function walks the linked list of pending payments to get the total count of pending payments     across all games.

getPlayerBalance(uint256,address).notice: Given a game ID and a payee address, return the amount of Ether owed to the payee, if any.  This value is the sum  of payments due to the payee across all games across all games.

makeGame(bytes32,uint256,uint256,address.notice: Monetary amounts should always be uint256 and be sent in GWei.  See the toWei() and toEth() Web3.js functions.  See the Game contract initialize() method for details on the parameters used in this method, since they share the same call signature. This function makes a new game.  See the addNewGame() method for parameter details except for the ID parameter, since that element is created during this method call. Only the contract administrator is allowed to make games.

setHouseAddress(uint256,address).notice: This method sets the house address for a game.  It must be called     before the start game call is made or that call will fail.

startGame(uint256).notice: This method starts the game.  Only the House can start a game and the  game must currently be in the CREATED state.

testEcRecovery(bytes32,uint8,bytes32,byt.notice: This method is for testing the technique of pulling out the Ethereum address from a signed element.  This is method requires a SEND transaction because it stores the results of the call to the smart contract.

testPayment(address).notice: Test making a payment.  This payable function takes an address and pays that address the amount of value that was provided by the caller.

testReturnTuple().notice: This function tests returning a tuple to an external caller.  It returns  a tuple containing an address and a number.

testViewMethodAsSendMethod().notice: This method is for testing the technique of sending a zero gas signed transaction to a method with VIEW visibility.
